definition: cause to move by turning over or in a circular manner of as if on an axis, the act of rolling something (as the ball in bowling)
details:
verb
- cause to move by turning over or in a circular manner of as if on an axis
= example: cause to move by turning over or in a circular manner of as if on an axis
= synonyms: revolve
- move, rock, or sway from side to side
= example: move, rock, or sway from side to side
- move about aimlessly or without any destination, often in search of food or employment
= synonyms: cast
- move along on or as if on wheels or a wheeled vehicle
= example: move along on or as if on wheels or a wheeled vehicle
= synonyms: wheel
- move in a wavy pattern or with a rising and falling motion
= synonyms: undulate, wave, flap
- emit, produce, or utter with a deep prolonged reverberating sound
= example: emit, produce, or utter with a deep prolonged reverberating sound
- sell something to or obtain something from by energetic and especially underhanded activity
= synonyms: hustle
- occur in soft rounded shapes
= example: occur in soft rounded shapes
= synonyms: undulate
- execute a roll, in tumbling
= example: execute a roll, in tumbling
- show certain properties when being rolled
= example: show certain properties when being rolled
= synonyms: roll up
- take the shape of a roll or cylinder
= example: take the shape of a roll or cylinder
- shape by rolling
= example: shape by rolling
- boil vigorously
= synonyms: seethe
- pronounce with a roll, of the phoneme /r/
= example: pronounce with a roll, of the phoneme /r/
- flatten or spread with a roller
= example: flatten or spread with a roller
= synonyms: roll out
- arrange or or coil around
= example: arrange or or coil around
= synonyms: wind, twine, wrap
- begin operating or running
= example: begin operating or running
- move by turning over or rotating
= example: move by turning over or rotating
= synonyms: turn over
noun
- the act of rolling something (as the ball in bowling)
= synonyms: bowl
- a flight maneuver
= synonyms: slip
- walking with a swaying gait
- the act of throwing dice
= synonyms: cast
- anything rolled up in cylindrical form
- photographic film rolled up inside a container to protect it from light
- a document that can be rolled up for storage
= example: a document that can be rolled up for storage
= synonyms: scroll
- a list of names
= example: a list of names
= synonyms: roster
- a long heavy sea wave as it advances towards the shore
= synonyms: roller, rolling wave
- the sound of a drum (especially a snare drum) beaten rapidly and continuously
= synonyms: paradiddle, drum roll
- a deep prolonged sound (as of thunder or large bells)
= synonyms: rolling, peal, pealing
- rotary motion of an object around its own axis
= synonyms: axial rotation, axial motion
- small rounded bread either plain or sweet
= synonyms: bun
- a roll of currency notes, often taken as the resources of a person or business
= example: a roll of currency notes, often taken as the resources of a person or business
= synonyms: bankroll
- a round shape formed by a series of concentric circles (as formed by leaves or flower petals)
= synonyms: whorl
